title: Ticket #1040: CondorUtils::runcmd() needs 'cmnt' optional argument
description:
When specifying optional arguments for CondorUtils::runcmd(), a new option argument cmnt should exist which allows one to emit a comment into the output, like this:

runcmd("echo foobar", {cmnt=>"This is debugging output."}); 

+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+ CMD[11/10/09 15:18:55]: echo foobar
+ SIGNALED: NO, RETURNED: 0, TIME 0.001991
+ COMMENT: This is debugging output.
+ BEGIN STDOUT
foobar
+ END STDOUT
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This makes it easy to explain why certain things are the way they are with a command in one conglomerate expression.

For bonus points, there is probably a perl module out there or idiom which will wrap the comment to N character columns, and that should be used effectively.
